intro: Tanacetum flabellifolium, commonly known as the fan-leaved tansy, is a perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves that give it its common name. The plant produces small yellow flowers arranged in flat-topped clusters, typical of the Asteraceae family. It thrives in sunny, well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and woodland edges. Tanacetum flabellifolium is known for its aromatic properties and has been used historically in herbal medicine.
